scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L is a star with 0.4 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 20873.98 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L system


OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L b

OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2018-06, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 1.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L b is 55.332 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L b is 8.590 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L c

OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L c was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2018-06, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 1.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L c is 83.634 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L c is 11.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2014-BLG-1722L - System With 2 Exoplanets
